text: Bottle, 22oz, shared by bergstaden. Its an unclear dark reddish colored beer with a dense, minimal sized off-white head. Hop-dusty, piney and resiny aroma with toffee and roasted malts. Some dried fruits, prunes and raisins. Its full-bodied, warming and smooth on the palate, with a decent bitterness. Roasted malts, booze, toffee and dried fruits in the flavor, then even more bitterness chiming in. Lasting finish with lots of booze and bitterness. Sweetness too, but not too much. Delicious indeed, but Id prefer it at a lower ABV. 170311

Bottle, courtesy of bergstaden. Pours deep brown with an off-white head. Aroma of dried fruits, malt, slightly boozy, caramel and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet and malty with some warming alcohol, vanilla, bourbon, caramel and dried fruits. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 650ml @ geokkjer
[Courtesy of bergstaden] Pours hazy brown with a beige to tan head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, dried fruits, oak, bourbon, alcohol and vanilla. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long warm, oak, dried fruity, bourbon, vanilla and caramel finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
I really like this beer, it is my favorite barrel aged beer. Every I find it I buy it.
This beer has an amazing vanilla aroma and lasting flavor of caramel. It is really much better than the un-aged beer.

A very nice bourbon barreled beer. Pours a deep red with a tan head. Smells of plum, bourbon, Apple and vanilla. Taste is similar, lots of dark fruit, Apple, vanilla and a malty, bourbon finish. Had in the bottle.

(En fût à Stout Burger L.A): Le liquide est magnifique avec sa couleur sang/acajou et sa mousse onctueuse et tenace. En bouche une tarte aux pommes et cerises, des houblons épicés et une pâte damandes sortie de nulle part atténue la chaleur mordante. La vanilline de barrique enrobe tellement adéquatement. World class.
On tap at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours dark brown with a thick tan head snd a treacle and bourbon aroma. There is a full-bodied dark molasses flavor with a lot of bourbon. A nice sipper.

Draft. Aged 6 months in Heaven Hill Bourbon Barrels. Mahogany beer with a tan head. Light bourbon and caramel aroma. caramel and light bourbon flavor. Medium bodied. Caramel and bourbon linger with light vanilla.

Bomber from Bine & Vine. Pours ruddy, very hazy, brownish with a slight tan head. Aroma of "freshly oxidized" malt, darkish fruits, and bourbon. Full bodied or nearly. Its bourbon and alcohol forward, with lots of darker fruit; the oxidized part seems to not be present? Damn tasty stuff. Dark fruits soaked in bourbon with some treacle enhancement. Liking it!

Sampled at GABF 2015. In the tasting glass clear reed with a tan head. Nose of caramel malts, wood, dark ripe fruit, citrus, and bourbon. Full body. Flavor is really rich and fruit is first, then oak wood, followed by bourbon on a smooth roasted caramel malt base. Well balanced and delicious. Love this one. When I get home I will pick up some bottles as this is local.
